description: Role-based phase terminology mapping for AID methodology

pm.name: Product Manager
pm.description: Focuses on user value, requirements, and business outcomes

lead.name: Tech Lead
lead.description: Focuses on architecture, technical decisions, and team guidance

developer.name: Developer
developer.description: Focuses on implementation, code quality, and TDD

qa.name: QA Engineer
qa.description: Focuses on testing, validation, and quality assurance

0.name: Market & Competitive Research
0.description: Research competitors, market trends, and validate the problem space with stakeholders

1.name: Product Requirements (PRD)
1.description: Define what we're building, user stories, acceptance criteria, and scope boundaries

2.name: Solution Review
2.description: Review technical approach, ensure it aligns with product vision and user needs

3.name: Roadmap & Prioritization
3.description: Prioritize features, define milestones, coordinate with stakeholders on timeline

4.name: Feature Validation & UAT
4.description: Validate implemented features against requirements, conduct user acceptance testing

5.name: Launch & Go-to-Market
5.description: Prepare release communications, coordinate launch, gather initial user feedback

0.name: Technology & Architecture Research
0.description: Evaluate technologies, assess technical feasibility, research architectural patterns

1.name: Technical Requirements Report
1.description: Translate business needs into technical requirements, identify constraints and risks

2.name: System Architecture Design
2.description: Design system architecture, define APIs, data models, and integration patterns

3.name: Sprint Planning & Task Breakdown
3.description: Break down work into epics/stories/tasks, estimate effort, assign to team members

4.name: Code Review & Architecture Oversight
4.description: Review code quality, ensure architectural compliance, mentor developers

5.name: Release Engineering & Deployment
5.description: Oversee deployment process, ensure operational readiness, manage release risks

0.name: Technical Spike & Research
0.description: Prototype solutions, research libraries/frameworks, validate technical approaches

1.name: Feature Specification
1.description: Understand requirements deeply, clarify edge cases, document technical assumptions

2.name: Technical Design
2.description: Design component structure, plan implementation approach, identify dependencies

3.name: Task Breakdown & Estimation
3.description: Break features into coding tasks, estimate complexity, identify blockers

4.name: Implementation & Coding
4.description: Write production code with TDD, implement features, write unit/integration tests

5.name: Bug Fixes & Polish
5.description: Fix bugs from QA, optimize performance, clean up code, update documentation

0.name: Test Strategy Research
0.description: Research testing approaches, evaluate tools, understand system testability

1.name: Test Requirements & Coverage Plan
1.description: Derive test requirements from PRD, plan coverage, identify risk areas

2.name: Test Architecture & Framework
2.description: Design test framework, set up automation infrastructure, define test patterns

3.name: Test Plan & Case Design
3.description: Write detailed test cases, design test data, plan regression suite

4.name: Test Execution & Automation
4.description: Execute tests, automate test cases, report bugs, verify fixes

5.name: Release Certification & Sign-off
5.description: Final regression, performance testing, sign off on release quality
